<a id="FogMaterial"></a>

# FogMaterial

**Inherits:** [Material](Material.md) **\<** [Resource](Resource.md) **\<** [RefCounted](RefCounted.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A material that controls how volumetric fog is rendered, to be assigned to a [FogVolume](FogVolume.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A [Material](Material.md) resource that can be used by [FogVolume](FogVolume.md)\\ s to draw volumetric effects.

If you need more advanced effects, use a custom [fog shader](../tutorials/shaders/shader_reference/fog_shader.md).

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="FogMaterial_property_albedo"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **albedo** = `Color(1, 1, 1, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#FogMaterial_property_albedo)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_albedo**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_albedo**\ (\ )

The single-scattering [Color](Color.md) of the [FogVolume](FogVolume.md). Internally, [albedo](FogMaterial.md#FogMaterial_property_albedo) is converted into single-scattering, which is additively blended with other [FogVolume](FogVolume.md)\\ s and the [Environment.volumetric_fog_albedo](Environment.md#Environment_property_volumetric_fog_albedo).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FogMaterial_property_density"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **density** = `1.0` [ðŸ”—](#FogMaterial_property_density)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_density**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_density**\ (\ )

The density of the [FogVolume](FogVolume.md). Denser objects are more opaque, but may suffer from under-sampling artifacts that look like stripes. Negative values can be used to subtract fog from other [FogVolume](FogVolume.md)\\ s or global volumetric fog.

\ **Note:** Due to limited precision, [density](FogMaterial.md#FogMaterial_property_density) values between ``-0.001`` and ``0.001`` (exclusive) act like ``0.0``. This does not apply to [Environment.volumetric_fog_density](Environment.md#Environment_property_volumetric_fog_density).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FogMaterial_property_density_texture"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Texture3D](Texture3D.md) **density_texture** [ðŸ”—](#FogMaterial_property_density_texture)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_density_texture**\ (\ value\: [Texture3D](Texture3D.md)\ )
- [Texture3D](Texture3D.md) **get_density_texture**\ (\ )

The 3D texture that is used to scale the [density](FogMaterial.md#FogMaterial_property_density) of the [FogVolume](FogVolume.md). This can be used to vary fog density within the [FogVolume](FogVolume.md) with any kind of static pattern. For animated effects, consider using a custom [fog shader](../tutorials/shaders/shader_reference/fog_shader.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FogMaterial_property_edge_fade"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **edge_fade** = `0.1` [ðŸ”—](#FogMaterial_property_edge_fade)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_edge_fade**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_edge_fade**\ (\ )

The hardness of the edges of the [FogVolume](FogVolume.md). A higher value will result in softer edges, while a lower value will result in harder edges.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FogMaterial_property_emission"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Color](Color.md) **emission** = `Color(0, 0, 0, 1)` [ðŸ”—](#FogMaterial_property_emission)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_emission**\ (\ value\: [Color](Color.md)\ )
- [Color](Color.md) **get_emission**\ (\ )

The [Color](Color.md) of the light emitted by the [FogVolume](FogVolume.md). Emitted light will not cast light or shadows on other objects, but can be useful for modulating the [Color](Color.md) of the [FogVolume](FogVolume.md) independently from light sources.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FogMaterial_property_height_falloff"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[float](float.md) **height_falloff** = `0.0` [ðŸ”—](#FogMaterial_property_height_falloff)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_height_falloff**\ (\ value\: [float](float.md)\ )
- [float](float.md) **get_height_falloff**\ (\ )

The rate by which the height-based fog decreases in density as height increases in world space. A high falloff will result in a sharp transition, while a low falloff will result in a smoother transition. A value of ``0.0`` results in uniform-density fog. The height threshold is determined by the height of the associated [FogVolume](FogVolume.md).
